IRBINFO: This was covered in our site consent form, and this specific case was reviewed by our IRB at a meeting.
PREDISC: We informed the patient that these were research results, and have some limitations.  We also informed them that they could contact us (Dr. Johnson or a coordinator) on any questions.
POSTDISC: Through the patient's clinician.  The patient is aware that they or the clinician can contact us for further clarification.

TYPEOTH: MRI Report of local clinical read. Images themselves not disclosed.
REASONOTH: The MRI read found a clinically relevant finding on the MRI, although not exclusionary for study participation.
CONSENTOTH: Disclosure of clinically significant MRI findings at PI/clinician discretion is specified in both the study protocol and and the informed consent form/HIPAA Authorization, all of which were approved by the IRB.
IRBINFO: Disclosure of clinically significant MRI findings at PI/clinician discretion is specified in both the study protocol and and the informed consent form/HIPAA Authorization, all of which were approved by the IRB.
IRBPROTO: The site PI reviews the MRI report and determines whether any findings on the MRI read are clinically relevant and warrant disclosure to the participant. If so, the PI contacts the participant by phone to discuss findings. A release of records is obtained from the participant, and the MRI report is then provided to the participant and their PCP, if the participant chooses.
RETURNPOS: Physician/site PI and Research Coordinator, respectively
RETURNTIME: Verbal discussion was conducted the day after MRI read, while the MRI report was provided to the participant at their next visit, 7 days after verbal notification.
RTNROLEOTH: Allison Perrin is the PI, while David Parkhurst is the Study Coordinator.
PTRESPONSE: Participant wanted to clarify some of the terminology in the report and the overall implications of the findings, which a site neurologist discussed with them.
PREDISC: Findings were discussed over the phone with site PI and participant's questions were answered.
POSTDISC: Participant had further questions after receiving a copy of the report, which were answered by David Weidman, Neurologist.

AMLYRESEXP: PI of original Avid autopsy study
PREDISC: Discussed subject’s concern about family history of dementia and her general health and absence of depression

IRBINFO: This process was added to our consent forms and approved by IRB.
IRBPROTO: Results will be blinded of study specific information and sent to PCP for evaluation and treatment of abnormal lab values.
CLRESPONSE: Unknown at this time. There has been no acknowledgement
PREDISC: Participant was given information over phone that labs would be shared with PCP for evaluation.
POSTDISC: Post disclosure, site agreed to help by sending any information needed to the treating physician.

AMYLRESNM: Amyloid PET images were sent directly to treating physician.
CLRESPONSE: Treating clinician expressed gratitude and said the PET scan data would help guide subject's diagnosis and treatment.
PREDISC: We stayed in touch with the participant and family via email and telephone calls, and answered any questions they had about MCI and AD.
POSTDISC: We continued to provide support over phone calls and emails.

IRBINFO: IRB permission not required on an individual basis. Authorization granted as standard of care through normal IRB approval processes.
IRBPROTO: Authorization has been obtained to share results of certain clinical tests and procedures if it is determined by a reviewing clinician to be in the participant's best interest, regardless of study relevance. In this case, a release of information to the participant and or participant's PCP is obtained, and the report is then sent to the respective parties with an IRB-approved letter. If necessary, the reviewing clinician can speak directly with participant and/or provider.
CLRESPONSE: Participant's PCP did not respond or speak to any study staff or providers.
PREDISC: Release of clinically relevant results was explained to participant, and participant was informed that their PCP may follow up with them if they find any further action necessary.
POSTDISC: Lab results were disclosed to PCP as potentially relevant to participant's care. A PCP letter was sent along with the lab report explaining that the labs were collected as part of research. Contact information for study site is provided should the PCP need to follow up with a coordinator or site clinician. If the information is serious or pressing, a site clinician may speak directly with the participant and/or treating provider.

IRBINFO: Disclosure of clinically-relevant results like labs is part of standard of care, and release of this information to treating clinicians is specified in the ICF/HIPAA document.
IRBPROTO: Lab results were faxed to PCP after brief discussion with participant and study partner.
CLRESPONSE: Response was not obtained from treating clinician.
PREDISC: No support or monitoring at the site beyond encouraging participant and study partner to discuss lab results with treating clinician.
POSTDISC: No support or monitoring at the site beyond encouraging participant and study partner to discuss lab results with treating clinician.

AMLYRESEXP: PI of original Avid autopsy study
POSTDISC: Discussed subject’s long-time concern, including family history of dementia, and that subject should remain in study with annual visits.

IRBINFO: It is part of the reviewed HIPAA release for the study
IRBPROTO: Pt. was notified that he had a slower-than-typical heart rate at the time of his ECG, and that we would go ahead and send the ECG printout to his PCP for their records and judgement. After obtaining an ROI for the release of the ECG to the participant's PCP, a copy of the ECG printout was sent via mail along with a letter from the PI encouraging the PCP to f/u with the pt. if he deemed the results to be clinically relevant.
PTRESPONSE: He indicated that he would discuss with his PCP
PREDISC: It was explained to the pt. that the results may or may not be clinically meaningful, but that we would send them to his PCP for his informed evaluation as his treating clinician.
POSTDISC: Any f/u with PCP is to be captured with medical history updates or check-ins. Pt. and his PCP also have the contact info for the PI and CRC for any further questions.

IRBINFO: Modification submitted to local IRB with ATRI-approved disclosure process and was IRB approved. ICF updated to reflect return of results to MCI or AD patients also IRB approved.
IRBPROTO: See approved amyloid disclosure plan, dated 19-Feb-2021.
RETURNPOS: Associate Professor of Neurology, Co-Director of PMC, PI of site 022 ADNI3.
AMLYLRESQU: MD, PhD - Assistant Professor of Neuology. .
AMLYRESTR: Appropriately trained to read amyloid scans.
PREDISC: Prior to disclosure, coordinator alerted subject and SP that we work closely with a social work team who can help prior to and after a disclosure. Dr. Wolk explained the description of the meaning of these results and how they could be interpreted. Answered all questions participant and SP had.
POSTDISC: 2 week check in to ensure participant and study partner were okay after disclosure. Confirmed they were.
